name: Yangshuo Tea Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in early May of this year and not only was the hotel spectacular, but the customer service was absolutely out of this world. There was a mixup with our ferry transfer and Curry, one of the owners, came out personally and found us to bring us to the hotel. All of the staff from top to bottom went completely out of their ways to help us out in any situation and make our stay the best it could possibly be. They even gave us a free cell phone to use when we went to town so that we could call the hotel to pick us up (at no charge!)
reviews.title: Possibly the best hotel experience I've ever had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, It was spectacular. An absolutely stunning setting a bit out of town, which made for great evenings enjoying our time on the patio and listening to the frogs outside. There are many bike paths nearby and beautiful scenery, and the hotel has bikes you can rent to make the most of it.
reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT FIND

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spotless, beautiful and decorated amazingly with great attention to detail. It felt very rustic and modern at the same time. Our room had a great wooden tub overlooking some rice fields next door, and the patio was one of our favorite places to spend our time. The grounds of the hotel are extremely well landscaped and very serene.
reviews.title: Magical place to take a break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I mentioned, the hotel has all the amenities you need. Bike rental, free car shuttles to town, and you can book tours through the front desk (and yes, they were a bit pricey sometimes, but worth it for what you get!). They have an in-room masseuse available, and their restaurant downstairs was one of the best we experienced in China. The crispy duck was fantastic!
reviews.title: Our best hotel experience in China

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really can't recommend this place enough if you plan to visit Yangshuo, it's probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Curry was absolutely great to deal with and everyone in the hotel made the stay very special.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with other visitors we met there, we discovered the Tea Cozy through the reviews on Trip Advisor, and were not disappointed. Having travelled through most provinces of China over the past two years, this is by far the nicest and most relaxing place we have stayed. Its setting, amidst rice paddies and impossibly pointy hills, 5km from Yangshuo, its comfortable rustic style and above all its amazingly friendly and helpful staff make it the ideal place to explore the delights of the Guilin region.
reviews.title: Homely cozy comfort at the Tea Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Built over 5 storeys (no lift) with 4-5 rooms on each level, each named after a variety of tea and roof terrace the hotel offers a range of room types and sizes. We had a king room with comfortable bed (rare in China), large wooden bath with separate shower and WC, equipped with kettle, tea making facilities, fridge, safe and small wardrobe, later moving to a twin room which was more than adequate and in someways had more useable space. The rooms are tastefully decorated, with back lit carved wall panels and Chinese furniture, flat screen TV and have panoramic windows offering a great outlook over the astounding countryside. They have a small balcony., and although we are in the countryside the road passing the hotel is surprisingly busy, with tour buses, cars and bikers. Fortunately the music playing through the panda speakers dotted around the garden and the artificial waterfall make the road noise less intrusive.
reviews.title: You must stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food and drinks are available throughout the day an evening on an outside terrace, with a wide range of western and Chinese dishes, including many local specialities, all very reasonably priced. Good coffee rare outside of T1 cities is readily available, using beans from the adjoining Yunnan province.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: A collection of cheeful, friendly, helpful staff is always at hand, all speak fluent English and are keen to provide assistance with luggage, transport, tours and recommend places to visit. The hotel has a stock of bicycles and tandems, all appear to be good nick and of a good standard, including some mountain bikes. Local tours can be arranged, using the hotel’s van or drivers, and although they don’t all speak much English, their driving skills and attitude is well above the norm. There is a complementary 3 times a day shuttle service into the city, and transfers to and from the airport (75km), river wharves and other attractions can be easily arranged at reasonable cost.
reviews.title: If you want beauty and hospitality in Yangshuo, this place is for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With its range of attractions, spectacular scenery and activities Yangshuo is one of the most rewarding places to visit in china for both domestic and foreign visitors, and if you don’t mind being a few kms out of the town, the Tea Cozy is an exceptional place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Stop!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Tea Cozy for 4 nights in April. I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor, and I must say, the excellent reviews are spot on. Richard, Curry, and the entire staff ensured that our every want and need was taken care of. In addition to arranging tours for us, Richard booked an airline flight and train tickets for us. James led us on a memorable bike ride through the countryside culminating with a fun and scenic ride down the river on a bamboo raft. This is a beautiful part of China which is made more beautiful by the wonderful staff at the Tea Cozy. If you're visiting China, I would strongly encourage spending some time in Yangshuo at the Tea Cozy. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Perfection at the Tea Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Tea Cozy, run by a young,energetic, accommodating staff is just a short distance from the crowded Yangshuo main part of town, and worth whatever slight inconvenience it is to get there. Views were beautiful from every floor. We were a group of nine and arranged to have bicycles brought to the hotel which enabled us to ride further into the countryside than most groups. Huge crowds sign up for early morning bike tours and clog the roads. We avoided that. The location is near Li River raft wharf, also crowded at times. Opt for the longer raft ride (more scenic) where you can be dropped off and picked up downstream,rather than the one that just goes back and forth a short distance. We did that, rather than the half-day cruise from Guilin. A two-night stay was perfect. We saw the extravagant 900-person water show one evening. Be prepared for crowds--3000 per show and 3 shows. Young weekend tourists from Guangshuo.
reviews.title: Charming and convenient rustic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Tea Cozy will appeal to most because the staff speaks english and all are very friendly and attentive to needs. The location is in a rural village outside of Yangshuo and is peaceful and set in a beautiful location around the limestone peaks. Three times daily complimentary shuttle service is offered into Yangshuo town. The rooms are large and comfortable and rustic. The balconies offer great views. The restaurant offers both local chinese food and western food. We did not use the tour service because my Chinese friend could make our own travel plans with local vendors.
reviews.title: friendly tea cozy inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I cannot compare to other properties in Yangshuo, but I must mention that we had a two bedroom villa in Dali and a suite on the peninsula at Lugu Lake in Yunnan for less money than Tea Cozy.
reviews.title: LUXURY in rural Yangshuo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at Tea Cozy from 29 Apr 2013. This was the first time my siblings and I took our 70+ years old parents for a holiday. As the organiser of this trip, I was in contact with Richard in March to seek advice about itinerary and tours. We became almost like pen pals as I had lots of questions and Richard replied almost immediately each time. Richard outlined a detailed itinerary for me and though I have to pay a lot more I was happy to do so because we required a personalised service. If only we can give more than the 5 stars here - it was an exceptionally wonderful experience for 5 of us. Richard and Curry are the utmost wonderful hosts and they paid attention to small details. Curry got us the best seats for the Impression Show and he was very mindful of our needs, making sure we got our exclusive treatment. We could not fault the high quality customer service. We love the location, the room and the food there.
reviews.title: Good, but not 'Wow'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful views of karst mountains from window, lovely clean rooms, great dinners on garden patio with charming English speaking staff. Inexpensive bike rentals on site for rides through farming countryside, water buffalo, rice, ancient stone villages. Manager very helpful in suggesting and arranging reasonably priced driving tours of area as well if wanted, and arranging visit to night lights show on river.
reviews.title: Great countryside hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish we had been able to stay much longer. Much better here than staying in city of Yangshuo itself with seemed extremely touristy and crowded.
reviews.title: Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights, only because we couldn't stay any longer. It was an incredible trip, a lovely location and a wonderful setting. The rooms had a the most wonderful view of the mountain scenery and was close to a beautiful bike trail. You can rent decent mountain bikes here and go up, though, do be warned, the trails are not clearly marked. You most likely will get lost, so just don't get split up like we did and all will be fine. The locals in the surrounding area are extremely friendly, and you if you speak a bit of Mandarin you'll be pointed in the right direction. A tip would be to write the address of Tea Cozy down in Chinese, as the cards they give out at reception didn't have a Chinese address on, making it a bit harder for locals to pinpoint.
reviews.title: I would go back to China just for this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though it rained pretty much the entire duration, we did get a day out on the bikes. And what a wonderful place to stay in during rainfall. The food downstairs is great and at a decent price.
reviews.title: Comfortable Fit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are so accommodating. We came down hungry at about 11pm after an early dinner and the kitchen was closed, but one of the staff (Can't remember her name now but she was so friendly) so kindly offered to prepare some soup herself, which she made from scratch. Friendly and smiling at every opportunity, and in a genuine manner as well, which made us feel so warm and 'cozy'.
reviews.title: Perfect !

description: About Yangshuo Tea Cozy Encircled by breathtaking Karst peaks, situated beside the banks of the Dragon River and hidden among local farmers’ fields, Yangshuo Tea Cozy Boutique Hotel is an ideal refuge away from the town’s crowded market streets. Come and relax in a peaceful and serene location just a short distance from Yangshuo’s famous West Street.Just as the tea cozy works in harmony with the teapot and keeps the tea warm, so we strive to surround you with the warmth of our hospitality and the beauty of the Yangshuo countryside. Tea is also a passion for us. We have a special tea house within the hotel and would love to welcome you as our guests for our next tea ceremony. Each of the twelve rooms in the Tea Cozy Boutique Hotel is unique and decorated in a traditional Chinese style with tastefully fitted wooden furnishings, personally selected by us. Every room houses an array of antiques and pieces of local artwork. Enjoy a comfortable night’s sleep on the best mattresses on the market before heading out onto the wooden balcony to take in panoramic views of the local landscape.If you are seeking action and adventure our dedicated team have expert knowledge of the local area and can arrange kayaking, white water rafting, climbing, caving and even camping. For those looking for more cultural immersion, we can arrange cooking lessons, tea ceremonies, tai-chi sessions with the local masters and more. Alternatively, if you are just seeking peace and quiet our rooftop bar and restaurant serving Chinese and Western cuisine from our organic garden providethe perfect backdrop for rest and recuperation.At the Tea Cozy Boutique Hotel we pride ourselves on high quality and personal customer service. Come and join a family atmosphere, walk among the paddy fields, meet the local villagers and immerse yourself in the local culture. We are committed to making your stay with us a magical and memorable one.
